results.title: Garden plants and how they grow
results.brief_description: Illustrates general principles of plant growth. Examines the interior of a seed; distinguishes plants which store food in their stems, leaves, roots and seed pods; compares plants grown in good and poor soil and in sunlight and shade; shows destructive animals and insects and those which are helpful to plants. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of bean seeds.
results.description: Illustrates general principles of plant growth. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of bean seeds.

results.title: The Garden of Gujurat
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and UNICEF
results.brief_description: More than 20,000 farmers and their families were eking a bare existence in the Kaira District of India. Through a modern milk plant, contstructed with the co-operation of UNICEF, the Food and Agriculture Organisation, the Government of India, New Zealand (under the Colombo Plan) and their own co-operative, scores of communities are benefiting, as well as the thousands of school children who are receiving daily rations of safe milk.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohan Wadhwani, Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and UNICEF

results.title: Garbage ouroboros
results.creator_credit: Milan Chuostek and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Municipal garbage is Public Enemy No. 1. While nature always recycles, man is the first animal who has broken the cycle. We must design for re-use, for to eliminate waste is to eliminate pollution. This program shows what amateurs and professionals are doing in Canada and the United States and makes suggestions for further strategies.

results.title: Gandhi's India
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes the life of Mahatma Gandhi, his policies and ideals and his influence on India’s progress towards independence. The film also considers how his views are related to Indian life in the 1960’s. Narrated by Alec Guinness.

results.title: Games of the XXI Olympiad: Montreal 1976
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Jean Beaudin, Marcel Carriere, Ashley Murray and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The official film of the Games of the XXI Olympiad, Montreal, 1976. A unique special for world television audiences, it probes behind the scenes, capturing the emotional dimensions of the athlete and his or her sport. It highlights certain teams and participants, before, during and after their events. This film approaches each event with the intention of revealing the athlete as an individual.

results.title: Games in the primary school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The purpose of games in the primary school is to develop children’s basic skills and attitudes. This film shows how a teacher in a primary school structures a physical education lesson to develop a repertoire of skills children can use in games they will be playing later on.

results.title: Games futurists play
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
An examination of some of the methods humans are utilising in their search for knowledge of existing social problems as well as projected social problems of the future. This film introduces us to new games now being played to prepare us for tomorrow. As we witness three such games, we see that apart from their childish role-playing aspect they can be constructive also.

results.title: Games and pastimes
results.brief_description: Top spinning competitions; kiteflying - often with elaborately painted kites; a type of football played with a woven cane ball; a form of self-defence, once serious and now a sport; traditional dances and new dances in traditional style; all a part of the leisure of Malayans, young and old.
